name: PHQ-9
summary: A 9-item depression screening tool with scoring guidelines.
description: A 9-question instrument for screening, diagnosing, monitoring and measuring the severity of depression.

items.text: Little interest or pleasure in doing things
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
Feeling tired or having little energy
Feeling bad about yourself — or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down
Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed. Or the opposite — being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual
Thoughts that you would be better off dead, or of hurting yourself

suicide_risk.message: Suicide risk screen positive - requires immediate clinical attention

clinical_interpretations.Minimal: Your score indicates minimal depression symptoms. This suggests you are experiencing few if any depressive symptoms that interfere with your daily life. Continue with healthy lifestyle practices including regular exercise, adequate sleep, social connections, and stress management techniques.
clinical_interpretations.Mild: Your score suggests mild depression symptoms that may occasionally affect your daily activities. Consider implementing self-care strategies such as regular physical activity, maintaining social connections, practicing stress reduction techniques, and ensuring adequate sleep. If symptoms persist for more than two weeks or worsen, consider consulting with a healthcare professional.
clinical_interpretations.Moderate: Your score indicates moderate depression that is likely impacting your daily functioning and quality of life. It is recommended to consult with a healthcare professional for proper evaluation and discussion of treatment options. Effective treatments may include counseling, psychotherapy (such as cognitive-behavioral therapy), lifestyle modifications, and in some cases, medication.
clinical_interpretations.Moderately severe: Your score suggests moderately severe depression that is significantly affecting your daily life and well-being. Professional evaluation and treatment are strongly recommended. Depression at this level typically responds well to treatment, which may include psychotherapy, medication, or a combination of both, along with lifestyle support strategies.
clinical_interpretations.Severe: Your score indicates severe depression that is substantially impairing your ability to function in daily activities. Immediate consultation with a healthcare professional is strongly recommended for comprehensive evaluation and treatment planning. Severe depression is highly treatable with appropriate professional care, and early intervention can significantly improve outcomes and quality of life.

sections.title: About the PHQ-9
sections.text: The Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9) is a multipurpose instrument for screening, diagnosing, monitoring and measuring the severity of depression.

sections.title: Instructions
sections.text: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?

sections.title: Scoring and Interpretation
sections.text: Depression severity bands: 0–4 minimal, 5–9 mild, 10–14 moderate, 15–19 moderately severe, 20–27 severe depression.

clinical_alerts.suicide_screening: Any positive response to item 9 requires immediate risk assessment
